intro: Hedlundia sognensis, commonly known as the Sognensis hedlundia, is a rare and lesser-known flowering plant native to specific regions in Scandinavia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hedlundia sognensis is considered a botanically significant but understudied species.
